title: 1974ish Signage Font
content:
These are door numbers on a performance space that was opened in 1974.  
I am not sure if they are from a font or were custom for the doors only. Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [photo-2.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420194334/http:/typophile.com/files/photo-2_0.JPG) | 377.12 KB |
| [photo copy.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420194334/http:/typophile.com/files/photo%20copy_2.jpg) | 113.91 KB |
author: gmor

comments.content: I can't find this exact font but I found one very similar to it. It was published in 1999 by Bright Ideas (a defunct foundry), is named **Stacker** , and is now apparently freeware available on the net. Do a search for "Bright Ideas Stacker font", in quotes, to find a download link.

The one I would go with is -Stack.

I remember it from the Letragraphica section at the back of the old 70's-80's Letraset catalogue.  
Although Bowfin has it listed from a Spanish Letraset page scan, and Luc Devroye seems to have the same pic.  
Not sure about a digital version though.  
Hope this helps.

[http://bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide05.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420194334/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide05.html "http://bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide05.html")  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51663.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420194334/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-51663.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-51663.html")

Here is a clear image of the character set of Stack by Face Photosetting as displayed in the Letraset Product Manual of 1985:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420194334im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StackFacePhotosettingSM_3627.jpg)
  
The image in the book would permit a more detailed scan for anyone who wishes to digitize the font.  
Don
